author: Johny373
title: If only someone would have looked at my results
body:
Was referred to C22 ward for CDT (catheter directed thrombolysis) after being diagnosed with a blood clot from Burnley General Hospital.  
Arrived at Royal Blackburn and was given a bed, not long after was told my procedure was cancelled due to there being an emergency, which I understand, these things happen.  
I was told that I'd be having a CT scan the next morning. Had CT scan next day and was discharged, assuming there was no risk and I'd have the procedure done at a later date.  
Within an hour of being at home my leg went purple, nearly passed out and was sweating profusely. Was rushed to hospital and ferried straight through A&E and underwent emergency surgery to save my leg.  
Luckily, the surgeons saved my leg, nearly bled out on operating table, spent 6 days on ICU, where I nearly bled out again, spent 7 weeks on vascular ward (C18B), nurses were phenomenal on there, everything was top notch apart from fact that I was discharged from C22 ward.  
If only someone would have looked at my CT results I would have never been discharged. I hold whoever signed my discharge and didn't look at CT results responsible for this. I nearly lost my leg and my life.  
I cannot believe I was discharged in such a serious situation, absolutely shocking!

author: Ayrpatient1
title: All done in less than two hours
body:
I would like to thank Stewart the Advanced Practitioner for his kindness, professionalism and care on my recent trip to Ayr ED.  
It was very busy in waiting room but I was taken quickly, my injury carefully listened and an indepth assessment on my low back conducted. Xrays were quickly taken. The porters and xray department were excellent in their care also.  
Stewart then could tell there was no new injury and prescribed painkillers and exercises for home. All done in less than two hours. Thank you for caring

author: airsp39
title: Maternal mental health
body: Following a traumatic time in hospital before the birth of my son, I was left feeling angry and vulnerable at the poor care I felt I received while on the maternity ward. Due to this I was referred to the maternity psychological services, where I received excellent care to aid my recovery from my experience. The service provided was kind and caring, with an understanding of the difficulties of combining treatment with child care. After extensive and thoughtful work with the psychologist, I have recovered and am in a much better place as a parent and a person. I’m very thankful to the maternity psychologist I saw.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: pepperfc53
title: Dumfries and Galloway Mental Health Services
body:
I moved to Annandale and Eskdale at the beginning of covid. I was very depressed at this point and was admitted to Midpark hospital. I spent just under a year there where I was diagnosed with EUPD and Recurring Depression. The care I received from nurses was exemplary. However, the hospital care I received in subsequent admission was seriously lacking with me making several serious attempts and just told I had capacity as an excuse to give no extra help.  
In August 2020 I was not offered any help despite saying I was going to end my life. No community support or other options, they just said I clearly wanted to die and there was nothing they could do about that. I left intending to harm myself. The staff then phoned the police despite being told by one of them suggesting I could kill myself if I wanted. I believe whether you have capacity or not you should be offered help and not made to feel like death is your only option.  
However, after the police stopped me and told my family to phone the police if I left the house I had some more period of instability. In and out of hospital which thanks to the 72 hours policy were no help and against nice guidelines. The failure of doctors in my care is almost made up for the wonderful nurses who I am very grateful to have had in my life.  
These nurses not only in Midpark and CATS who are all for the most part equally amazing. Annandale and Eskdale CMHT are the reason I’m still here. They have spent 1000s of hours talking to me, crying with me and laughing with me through it all. They have taken my phone calls when I’ve been at the end, stuck up for me against doctors who hold a deep rooted stigma against EUPD (need more training) and celebrated my milestones with me. I want to say a special thank you to my wonderful CPN. They have supported me from just before I spent a year in hospital to now where I am now holding down a job and moving to a new area for this job and have not self-harmed for 6 months.

author: Phil90378
title: Colonoscopy at Raigmore Hospital
body:
I was booked to have an endoscopy and colonoscopy with sedation.  
I have the endoscopy first and was adequately sedated for this procedure as wasn’t aware it had been done. But when it was finished and time to do the colonoscopy the effects of the sedation had completely worn off, so I had to endure the whole procedure of the colonoscopy without any sedation.  
It was very uncomfortable and painful at times. A nurse was doing their best to help me relax by talking to me during the procedure, but all I wanted was the sedation to help me relax.  
I was told I would be sedated for the whole procedure, I certainly didn’t expect the effects to wear off after the endoscopy. It has left me feeling rather distressed that I had to endure that procedure with little or no sedation. I was fully awake and aware of everything, not happy with the whole thing at all, and certainly won’t be back that procedure, that's for sure.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: So far in the past year with this practice I've had to get 2 antibiotics and statins from an EU country as well as use private insurance to get tests done via BUPA (the results of which the practice had and then lost). Its as if the NHS no longer exists. You cannot get an appointment for love or money. If you call at 8am they just close the phone on you. There is no online booking system. And even if you do get to a nurse (not even a GP) seing that your cholesterol is high for a long period they will just tell you to come back in 6 months (if you are still alive of course). You are left on your own to source appropriate medication. And if you get a UTI or pleumonia you have better find some antibiotics yourself as you can't even get an appointment let alone help. And are you on immunosuppressants and have Covid? Thought. No antivirals available. Just generally you are going to be left dealing with Google and ChatGPT for a diagnosis and medical advice... dangerous really.

title: Arrogant, rude and unhelpful reception staff
body: Lost my 1st samples and didn’t bother to inform me. When I was chasing for my report arrange phone call from pharmacists and I have been told my sample lost. Second samples given. Report already out last week Wednesday and called next day morning. I had requested appointment/call from doctor because reports were out of range and new developed symptoms but receptionist refused to give either of the appointments and I have been told doc will call me once they read report. Till date I haven’t received any phone call. Both of my reports have few things out of range.

title: urgent help needed - was seen same day
body: Very impressed to call at 530 on a friday and be able to get an appointment 20m later. Would recommend Southam Surgery.

author: Besotted mum
title: Everyone I met was friendly and welcoming
body:
I came into Ayrshire maternity for a planned C-section, Everyone I met was friendly and welcoming and very reassuring as I was an emotional teary mess.  
Things didn't quite go straightforward and my little princess had to go to nicu, I was also quite poorly so I didn't get to meet my baby until she was 5 hours old, the recovery team where amazing at keeping me calm and worked hard to get me well enough to go round to meet her.  
The staff in nicu again were amazing explaining everything and reassuring me that baby was definitely doing better and going in the right direction, I really felt my baby was in good hands. I appreciate everyone that was involved in our care, we will still be here for a few days but felt praise was required now.

title: Surpassed themselves.
body:
A few weeks ago I saw a doctor for painful legs. It was suggested that physiotherapy would be beneficial, and an appointment was made for last Saturday morning, at the Nightingale surgery. At 8am I was phoned by a male who asked me if I was attending the surgery that morning, then did I know what for, and did I expect to be treated. When I answered in the affirmative to all questions I was told that they didn't do physio there, so don't come. 
How can a doctor of that surgery book me in for a procedure that doesn't exist at that surgery? I was then told that someone would phone and 'sort me out'. I'm not holding my breath.

title: No doctors and same excuses
body: My son couldn't breathe and went to nutgrove villa his blood oxygen levels were very low they gave him medication told him to contact the doctor's urgently which he tried to told them what nutgrove villa said phone back tomorrow  he has got 62 phone call attempts on his phone incompetence of this practice is unbelievable

title: trying to see a doctor
body: I've been trying the surgery for the last few weeks trying to get to see a doctor but nobody will answer the phone as its always engaged. The automated service says try the pharmacy or the walk in centers, I have and the pharmacy said try the walk in center so I did. they gave me medication which I have used and my symptoms have got worse. I thought I would try ringing to get a doctors appointment again today, after 77 phone attempts I gave up I don't know what I can now do to see a doctor. This is a joke as I am getting worse with my condition and the doctors are none contactable behind the system that's in place

author: X.O.X.O
title: We found out no one had referred him
body:
When my baby boy was born we were informed he could have Hypospadias. The day we was released from hospital we waited 10 hours for different people to check this out.  
Each time we was told he would be referred to get it check. On every maternity appointment we had at Newcross we asked if he had been referred and every time they said yes. We waited 10 weeks and found out no one had referred him, now we have to wait until August as there are no appointments available to see if we could possibly get one then.  
We have been given incorrect information numerous times and my child has been let down.

title: Still waiting for a ring back appointment
body: I have had the experience of being given a wrong appointment date and 3 weeks later am still waiting for the receptionist to ring back with a new appointment I have never before missed an appointment. Why is the surgery still following covid rules I have been able to access an out of hours surgery with no covid problems whatsoever. Things were happening with accessing the surgery before covid and there is still no improvement I have been reading previous reviews looks like maybe new management is needed where people can actually have face to face appointments I have been in other surgeries and spoken to other people about access to their gps and they have no problems  there are some serious issues going on here too many patients and not enough gps how much longer am i going to have to wait for another appointment?

title: system online account
body: Since i asked for a prescription to be submitted face to face in the surgery ,i am now unable to access my online account. it will not accept my stored username and password. i have been sent text messages with my username and different passwords and they do not work. This really is frustrating, i do not know why me submitting a paper prescription has generated this mess.  So much unnecessary time, has been spent trying to sort this. still not working!

title: Terrible Experience
body: Worse hospital experience of my life! Me and my fiancée been waiting to get attend after nearly over 20 hours. Got told we'll be seen by a doctor in 5-7 hours. At times when I'm asking for the staff seem to have no clue and kept increasing times. My fiancée took a fit since she's epileptic and 24 weeks pregnancy. Nurses kept saying doctor will be with us shortly then 4 hours later said the wait is looking at 21 hours! Highly won't recommend this hospital! They rather attend someone that has a cut than someone babies life at risk!

author: indiayy98
title: Assessment for hernia surgery
body: I was only there for an hour but I was really happy the way the short experience was very professionally handled and that made me feel good. From entering the building to leaving the hospital i had no problems at all.Polly who took me through the assessment was excellent really helped me through the process and explained everything.Thank you.

title: Poor Service for booking &  answering phone
body:
I have been trying to call the gp surgery to make an appointment and waited for a hour to someone answered my call.  They can’t book me an appointment , been told to call back around 11am , so I did , but while on the phone for almost half an hour I decided to drove there in the surgery and saw them not busy and just ignoring the calls, while staffs just chatting around and I told the receptionist  I’m still on my phone call but no wants answering ? Really poor service. Receptionist cannot give me an early appointment, the earliest one is after a month .  All I want is just a phone from the GP to request a routine blood test . Now they told me to call again around 2 pm for a face to face appointment, which is going to waste of time again, all they will do is to give me the printed blood test request that they can normally sent me a link to book in the hospital.  For your information the e-consult is always offline that’s why I called them for booking. She told me to keep checking, but I’m sorry I’m not always on the phone checking the website to open .
This surgery is lack of service.  Urgently need improvement .  This is not happened once.

author: sunflower23
title: Physiotherapy/hydrotherapy
body:
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
[Very unhappy with 'Transport']  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
[Unsure about 'Toilet']  
[Very happy with 'Waiting time']  
[Very happy with 'Cleanliness']  
[Very happy with 'Finding your way']

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not great
body: I have been trying to get an appointment to speak/see a GP and can never seem to get one before 3 or 4 weeks. I think it is not right if you need to see a GP urgently and have to wait that long I should not have to go private for medical help. Please bring back the online appointments booking system where patients who work can get appointments. I am very dissapointed with this surgery.

title: Been let down big time
body:
My Elderly mother was miss diagnosed by nurse was told she had been given antibiotics but in fact they was to stop itching 
Then months later was given antibiotics which she should not have been given with medication she already on 
She been poorly all weekend 
Gets call from surgery to say stop tablets they wrong ones 
She should not have been given in first place 
So if you are a patient check your medication

title: Cannot get through
body:
I have been trying to make an appointment (non emergency) repeatedly, but just cannot get through on the telephone. This has been going on for months and it is no different, I cannot make contact. 

The example of today, I call the practice number, select the number, to be told  Im in a que and I'm caller 30. Twice when I have rung, Ive had the same message. I cannot email in an enquiry as the capacity has been reached?! 

How am I supposed to be able to communicate with someone to know where to direct me to? 

I do not know what options there are......this is not something for an emergency department (or ever will be), so how can I speak to a health professional?

title: ineffective new appointment booking system
body:
trying to get an appointment is an uphill feet of endurance. First a long form to fill in online - day1. then day 2 a doctor requested  I send a photo of the problem. day 3, a text confirms this indeed warrants an appointment and I am asked to wait until they decide the date and time for the appointment. I am still waiting. 
Did the modality group really do any market testing before this new system was adopted? at what point does this constitute a responsive service? The system wholly relies on you having computer skills, a mobile phone that is on all of the time and significance  patience as you wait and wait for an appointment. If you cannot make the appointment, I presume you go through the whole sad experience again from scratch?? meanwhile, treatment for our health problems is being  delayed, our conditions worsen and in some instances, are life threatening?? please modality think again and introduce an effective appointment booking  system for everyone.

title: Disgusting public toilet in reception
body: I have to bring my elderly mother to the clinic here twice a week. We find that the cleanliness of ladies toilet is terrible the actual toilets always look unclean the  floor looks awful really dirty with strips of veneer that have come away from the wall also the bin is always overflowing hand towels etc over the floor.  I just feel that in a place where many people visit that are ill that cleanliness should be more of a priority. It needs a total steam clean. I wouldn’t like to think what the men’s toilet is like!

title: Awful service
body: We have used Ilkeston hospital a number of times and always been really impressed however today we received awful service. The receptionist was unbelievably rude to everyone who entered, including refusing to let elderly people have a seat because they were not the patient even though there were lots of free chairs. My mum has injured her wrist and as advised by 111 we attended the urgent treatment centre, the nurse told her the way she injured it won’t have been enough to have caused a break so she refused to x ray it. It has been this bad for a week now, and we cannot get into the GP but she has told us if we would like an x ray we should go to the GP to be referred for one, this seems like such a waste of NHS time when we were already there and had waited 2 hours. My mum was really upset at how she was as spoken to by the nurse, who told her she should have just gone to the pharmacy instead. The whole experience is something we do not want to go through again so we will be avoiding.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impossible to get anyone to answer the phone.
body: Reception is really poor at responding to calls. How can you wait in a que for 15-20 mins, sometimes longer, to finally get through to a ringing tone & then have nobody answer? What is this? An exercise in how to throw money down a drain in telephone costs while you get nowhere? The system is broken beyond belief, not fit for purpose.

title: Very helpful
body: Called in to the surgery at 11 o’clock this morning with a suspected urine infection, the receptionist was very sympathetic & professional, in no time at all I got an appointment with the doctor at 11.40. Thank you.

title: Ongoing Tablet Ordering
body: Despite a glitch with re ordering  my many tablets using the computerised system, a quick visit to the reception had it resolved in 5 minutes. Thank you so much Team Hollybrook.

title: Poor practice
body: My wife attended the surgery the other day for some blood tests and on the way out asked why her prescription had been changed and no one informed her. She asked the receptionist if she could book a consultation while she was at the surgery, the reply was no you have to phone it in. After 30 phone calls we still have no joy at all at getting through. This type of attitude must stop or somebody will end up very ill due to this.

title: Truly dreadful practice
body: Went to see GP at the beginning of the year after waiting over two months for appointment. Diagnosed with an ear infection and given antibiotic drops and tablets even after I told him I could not take oral antibiotics.  The tablets made me I’ll so I continued with the ear drops.  Made another appointment still with a two month wait.  In the meantime Googled my symptoms of Tinnitus in one ear. Was extremely alarmed to see that if it n one ear only this must always be considered to be a red flag.  As the wait was so long and none of the staff were answering the phone I paid privately to see someone else.  Was sent for an immediate MRI scan and then given diagnosis of Acoustic Neuroma.  I have now changed my GP practice as this was the final straw. Such a change to have a receptionist who not only answers the phone but actually looks at you and smiles instead of treating you with contempt. Kingsbury have some terrible reviews on their web site and something should really be done about that practice.   I stood them for thirty years and had almost got used to having to drive there when I wanted to speak to them .   The staff were never busy and did their best to ignore patients.  I should have left long ago and I would recommend that everyone else do the same

author: piscesbh47
title: They abruptly ended the call
body:
I fainted randomly while sat down and had tingly legs and arms - explained this. I called 111 and the person I spoke to said I needed to go back to hospital (previously had an ecg) to have another ecg.  
They were talking fast and I couldn’t hear them well so asked to slow down.  
I explained that it was late and that I couldn’t get to A&E at this time (nearly 1am), they then suggested that I should get a taxi and I explained I couldn’t get a taxi as I couldn’t afford one. They then kinda huffed and asked if I knew the risks - and again I explained that I couldn’t afford one. They abruptly ended the call saying to call my GP in the morning.I was left in tears and panicked.

author: DavidHyp
title: I certainly felt very well looked after
body:
I had two emergency open heart ops. The first was a CBG4 (forth cryoballoon generation) and around 3 weeks later I had to have an emergency debridement for a major mediastinitis infection behind the breastbone.  
When I returned home I was initially looked after by the District Nursing Team until the vacuum dressing could be removed.  
I then came under the care of nurses from the Community Cardiac Service in Fife. Their work was reminiscent of the days when the NHS actually worked. They came to my house several times and I certainly felt very well looked after.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Extremely Disappointing Experience
body:
I recently had the displeasure of contacting Mission Medical Practice and I must say, it was an incredibly frustrating and disappointing experience. I called with a genuine concern, hoping to receive some medical advice or assistance, but what I encountered was a series of issues that left me feeling utterly dissatisfied. The amount of time I had to spend on the phone was absolutely ridiculous.  I was left waiting for an excruciating 65 minutes before someone finally bothered to answer my call.

Unfortunately, the receptionist who eventually picked up was not only unhelpful, but also remarkably rude. Instead of showing empathy or attempting to understand my situation, they were dismissive and seemed disinterested in helping me. I expected a certain level of professionalism and courtesy from a healthcare provider, but this receptionist's attitude left much to be desired.

I was taken aback when the receptionist did not even bother to ask about my symptoms or concerns. Instead, they immediately informed me that the practice was fully booked and advised me to call back the next day. This lack of willingness to even listen to my concerns made me question the level of care and attention that patients receive at Mission Medical Practice.

Overall, my experience with Mission Medical Practice was extremely disappointing. The excessively long phone wait times, rude receptionist, lack of concern for my symptoms, and the dismissive attitude left me feeling neglected and undervalued as a patient. I expected better from a healthcare provider, and I strongly recommend considering other options if you are seeking prompt and compassionate care.

title: So far, outstanding.
body:
Since joining Schopwick last year, I have found an individual GP that offers me continuity of care for a complexed medical situation, fantastic would be an understatement when it comes to my preferred doctor. I cannot offer enough praise for them. 

Secondly, in my personal experience, I have found the staff at the surgery to be friendly, communicative & helpful. 

The administration staff have always offered the choice of face to face or telephone appointment.

Furthermore, the options offered and service for patients are intuitive and thoughtful: 

text services for: 
-Doctor patient communication outside of appointments.
- Community engagement events
- Local health circumstances 
- Upcoming appointments  

Online communication with the practice:
You can use a service they offer called “Patchs” through their website and contact the practice, you can ask for your preferred practitioner & explain your circumstances this will lead to further action such as an appointment with your doctor. 
You can request repeat prescriptions here also. 

I am a patient at this practice & I am happy with the practice right now. 

As we all know things can change, however that doesn’t just have to be negative change. 

I would urge any patient to speak to their practice, find a preferred doctor that you like, trust & feel you can communicate openly and freely with. 

This will greatly improve your relationship with your GP practice & in your times of need, you will feel much more comfortable in arranging treatment. 

Remember outside of emergency appointments, so long as your preferred doctor is available it is your right as a patient within the NHS to be able to see the doctor or nurse of your choosing :) 

This is not a reflection of anything other than our personal preferences and who we feel comfortable seeing and sharing our health concerns with.  

Having had the unfortunate experience of having to deal with a truly woeful practice in the past. As of mid 2023 I rate schopwick as outstanding, true to their current CQC rating.  

I hope that Schopwick continue to work so openly with their patients and strive for even more, servicing the local community & giving their patients peace of mind that when they need help, it’s there & it’s going to be ok. 

Finally, I would urge anyone who is unhappy to seek change, try a different Doctor, Schopwick I believe is a training GP practice, so there’s lots of new doctors and also a group of really fantastic experienced doctors. 

Communicate, you may find someone right for you that can really help. 

Like anything, no body or entity should be above criticism or beneath praise, my review is based on current personal experience & is subject to change both positively and negatively.

Thanks for reading this novel of a review!

title: Perscription review
body: Both my husband and I have experienced difficulty when our reviews are due.  Although we have complied by completing and returning information by paper (which was lost twice) or on line asap our percriptions were not activated when due for collection.  Neither of us have had reviews by phone or face to face since before the pandemic.  We find this both frustrating and concerning

title: Negligent surgery
body:
Recently moved to this surgery, previous GP advised I required a smear test which I was unable to go ahead with due to moving house and changing address.

Despite making this clear to this surgery and explaining my symptoms they're refusing to go ahead with this due to their policy which requires me to wait until next year.

Refusing a smear test when I have serious symptoms and risking my health due to a policy is not good enough.

title: Very bad service
body: I want to book appointment in morning and i call in morning but they told we will call you bakck in 2 hours but there is more than two hours but no replay from gp.

title: Great practice.  Very friendly.
body: Although the practice are extremely busy, when I get through on the phone, staff are helpful, courteous and polite. Always take the time to make me feel listened too even though most days they have probably spoken to a huge number of people.  Great team. 👍

title: Needs appointment overhaul
body:
I joined this surgery a year ago, despite anecdotal stories of how dreadful it is but I am now looking to leave the practice. 
It is virtually impossible to get through by phone, and the number of times I've been in the hold queue and then cut off is ridiculous. 
I have not been able to get an appointment at the surgery - slots are only open for a few weeks at a time but I have never managed to find a time where they actually have appointments either by booking online or via phone. 
When I did manage to get an appointment within a 6 week window, by physically going in to book one, it was provided at a different surgery, literally a 25 minute drive away. 
The appointment system needs a complete overhaul at this surgery.

title: Really good doctors but sometimes there is admin…
body: The doctors at this surgery and nurses are always fantastic and usually the admin is relatively on the ball too. I have, however, been waiting 6 days for my medical records to be released to a private healthcare provider, something that a lot of people with other surgeries have had within the day. It’s a bit disappointing after so many positive experiences with the practice.

title: Query re 'flu vaccination
body: I require an annual 'flu vaccination and due to an allergy to formaldehyde receive the nasal vaccination.  On 2 occasions I have been given contradictory advice - on the first occasion I was advised by a receptionist that formaldehyde was no longer included in the vaccine.  Following that during my last asthma review I was informed that only those vaccines with formaldehyde were currently available with no option suggested.  Could this be clarified please.

title: Money rippers
body: Expensive carpark for everyone, no discount no free parking for patients who need surgery and need to stay 1/2/3/4/7/14 days. How to turn a service paid by taxes into a privilege. Shame on you all.

title: Cleaners I doubt it
body:
I was sat in a+e waiting room and seen a young serco cleaner enter the toilet with only a pink/red cloth I presume to clean said toilet room. He then exited the toilet room and continued to use that same cloth to clean the door furniture. Now as a cleaner myself I use a disinfectant to clean a bathroom and use a separate cloth to clean the toilet and don't use that same cloth again.
Also when in the a+e cubicle 12 the trolley/bed leavers on the bottom of the bed had dried blood on them. You shouldn't leave hospital with mor germs than you went in with. Cleaners need an overhaul. Disgraceful.

title: One the worse hospitals
body: Terrible hospital staff unqualified don't really know how to treat  your problem and don't listen fully to your problem u came in with u wait hours to be seen only for them to want to only give 5 minutes of their time

title: Compassionate and patient doctor
body:
I recently visited Ninfield Surgery with my son, where we were fortunate to be under the care of one of the male doctors. My son tends to feel anxious about visiting the doctors, and during our visit, he needed his first blood test, which he was quite apprehensive about. However, the doctors exceptional approach made all the difference.

The Doctor demonstrated remarkable consideration and empathy towards my son. He took the time to explain the entire procedure, showing him the equipment being used and reassuring him that feeling nervous in new situations is perfectly normal. Thanks to his caring demeanor, my son felt more at ease, and the doctor was able to successfully take his blood on the first attempt.

The compassionate and patient approach displayed by the doctor truly transformed what could have been a horrible appointment into a much more positive experience. I am immensely grateful for his assistance and wanted to express my heartfelt appreciation.

I also want to mention the exceptional service provided by the rest of the nurses and receptionists at the surgery. They have always been polite and go above and beyond to assist whenever I call.

Overall, our visit to Ninfield Surgery and the exceptional care we received from the doctor and the entire team has left a lasting impression. We sincerely hope that Dr pm knows just how much of a positive impact he has made, and I would highly recommend his services to others in need of medical care.

title: Stressful
body: Like fort knox, impossible to get access,  no clear instructions, pressed buzzer which made noise, door remained closed, no communication from staff on the entry system.  Considering the majority of people who come are visual impaired, this is unacceptable.  Once inside, very busy, hardly any spare seating, numerous people coughing and spluttering in the small waiting area.   All in all a very stressful experience.

title: Room for improvement
body:
I attended a gynaecology appointment earlier this month (June 2023) for an ongoing issue I have been experiencing for a couple of years. While the consultant I saw was friendly and knowledgeable, she was multi-tasking (took two phone calls during my consultation time). I also felt that the consultation was a bit rushed, and given that I am self-funding my treatment because of NHS delays I expected at least not to feel rushed and like I was receiving good quality treatment. That said, I was happy that I received some treatment there and then, even if I only had a split second to think about it and it went well with minimal discomfort so I was grateful for that.

I wasn't too happy, however, when I received a quotation which was much higher than I had initially been quoted for a follow up procedure and one of the managers who I talked to was not sympathetic and even told me 'not to shout' and that she would put the phone down when I was merely frustrated and did not raise my to her once voice once (please check the recording). I do feel like communication can be improved. I don't expect to be talked to like that, especially when I am paying through the nose for private treatment. If the quotation was more accurate in the first place, it would have avoided a difficult conversation. 

All in all, there is some room for improvement and I hope you see this feedback as constructive.

title: Giving the impression of contempt for patients
body:
I waited inside the house for 10 hours for a telephone call from a GP - required by the rather thoughtless "You can expect a call, text or email [before 6:30pm] - we will only attempt a call twice" message I had received. I understand that people are busy, but calling twice, very briefly and in very quick succession, after the 10 hour allotted time period has elapsed meant both calls were missed; the appointment was lost and had to be (laboriously) rebooked. 
Channeling work through the eConsult system and sending crass automated responses to these shows a systematic disregard for patients that is shameful and worrying. I would be grateful if you would flag this issue to the Partners.

title: Absolutely shocking
body: I recently requested a repeat prescription for hayfever medication which got rejected! I have suffered severe hayfever for around 20 years and in the past 4 years this has also affected my breathing requiring me to use an inhaler. I have spent almost 4 hours trying to contact the surgery to see where my prescription is up to only to be told it has been rejected as it can be bought otc. I asked for an appt with a doctor (the girl on the phone had a serious attitude and could probably do with learning some customer care skills) but there were no bookable appointments available. Anyway, after a couple of phone calls to different chemists, it was confirmed that you cannot buy my usual hayfever medication or blue inhalers otc as they can only be prescribed by a medical professional. I called the surgery back (which took another hour to get through), the girl was very helpful and somehow managed to find an appt for me 2 days later. I understand there are procedures etc to follow but I have an ongoing allergy which I have been prescribed medication for most of my life and I shouldn't be having so much trouble with this. Absolutely shocking service!

title: Faultless A & E experience
body: 04/06/23 10.15 am  Arrived A&E reception having fallen and grazed R/H arm from wrist to above elbow.  Swiftly through Triage and after a wait of 10-15 min I was seen and the wounds examined.  Shortly after, the areas of skin that had been scraped down in the fall were returned to their correct position and the areas dressed.  Advice for re-dressing was given.  All the medical staff were kind, understanding and a perfect example of what I believe an A & E service within the NHS service should be.  All the medical staff who have redressed my wounds subsequently have praised the treatment given to me originally and state that the efforts of those at Furness General Hospital have assisted the healing and much reduced any permanent scarring.  I am deeply grateful to them for their skills that enabled me to carry on enjoying my holiday from which I have just returned.  Thank you very much.

title: Utter let down
body: Ask my GP, before covid you could pick your slot and doctor. Having done ask my GP and get told to go to GP alliance, when all you want is to see your own doctor, it’s an utter let down. This surgery has gone down hill very rapidly and some reception staff are abrupt. No wonder A and E is always busy, people going there because of lack of appointments, really considering moving GPs

title: Diabetes review
body: Test results for sugar levels for my partner are very high despite being on medication. Cannot get an appointment for a month!!! Only 1 diabetic nurse specialist in the practice. Ridiculous, only needs prescribed a different tablet, can a doctor not do this instead having to wait a month with an already high reading. Not acceptable at all.

title: Rude receptionist
body:
I am coming off Diazepam and I am getting very bad and nasty withdrawal symptoms to the extent of not being able to go out. I called the surgery earlier and asked for a phone consultation with my GP and the receptionist said "There is nothing available, OK?"and promptly terminated the call. I wasn't asked what it was about or if it was urgent. I called back and was lucky to get someone else who was very helpful and understanding. 
Now, the receptionists are our first port of call when we are unwell and this is not acceptable. I didn't call just to pass the time but because I am at the end of my tether and need help to manage the withdrawal symptoms. 
We are asked to polite and respectful when calling the surgery. Maybe the receptionists should be reminded that this works both ways and we are entitled to the same courtesy. 
However, as I said, the second receptionist I talked to was absolutely brilliant and I have an appointment for tomorrow.

title: Very poor service
body: On hold for 24 minutes and 16 seconds listening to a recorded message on a loop.  Finally answered and was cut off after giving the requested date of birth.  I appreciate that the lines may be busy and that some calls take longer but to then cut off the call is extremely poor.  Thank goodness I was not trying to get through for urgent advice.

title: So many errors.
body: It's extremely difficult to get an appointment here. I have waited 45 mins on the phone to try. I have been told to come into the surgery for the appointment, only to arrive and be told it was a telephone appointment. I've booked a smear test and been given the wrong day after taking time off work, and I've ended up with 12 month's worth of medicine that I never ordered. Don't be ill here.

title: Getting worse
body: I have been ordering monthly for my husband supplies from fittleworth for the past 10 years and I’m sorry to say just lately they are rapidly getting worse there is something missing from his order just about every month and when I phone them up about it they blame the GP surgery not sending the prescription but when I phone our GP it has been sent to them. I am currently looking for another supplier for him.

title: Terrible
body: It is impossible to get an appointment. You can be stuck on the phone for over an hour waiting to speak to reception. The website tells you to download the Dr iq app which doesnt work. The only way to speak to someone is to walk in to the practice and queue for ages just to be told that you cannot see a doctor as there is a one month wait. Strangely enough however there are 'clinicians' available ready to sell drugs to you. I had a bad reaction to medication I was prescribed so stopped taking it while I tried to book an appointment but had to wait 11 days for an emergency appointment, that was then cancelled without being rebooked. Since the practice was acquired by an American private enterprise the service standards have significantly suffered, to the detriment of patients. There is a constant stream of reception staff having to be trained as no one wants to stay there very long having to deal with irate, frustrated and fed up patients.

title: Worst reception
body:
Constant problems with reception both in person and on the phone which only takes a few hours to get to speak to one of the ignorant unhelpful people that get paid for arriving there each day but not actually doing their job.
Customer service at it's worst.

title: Really
body: Seen the consultant in may who wrote to this GP asking for a medicine to be added. Seen another consultant today in same department and asked if I had been taking the said medicine and it’s should have been prescribed a month ago by the GP. It hasn’t and it’s effecting my condition. It’s terrible service. I have a serious illness and things like this certainly do not help.

title: Patch Test Basford
body: l had a patch test done at Basford consulting rooms ,the nurse was very friendly and full of good advice,it was a very relaxing atmosphere,easy parking would highly this service.

title: Suprapubic Catheter change
body: The Doctor on duty today was Courteous but more importantly highly efficient.  The nurse attending was considerate and the Receptionist welcoming

title: Worst practice ever
body: You may be surprised that a new state of the art medical practice would come up to high standards regarding the service that they provide, but this is definitely not the case. You cannot get an appointment until weeks away. You ring and are told that we’re be experiencing high demand of calls and that you are number 21 in the queue, and to request call back which when you do there is no call back! I’ve tried numerous times over the past few weeks and have just given up with the practice , and I am now looking at registering at another medical practice as I’ve had enough of the extremely poor service offered at Hadrian Heath.

title: A & E Wait Times Unacceptable
body:
Brought my husband to a & e at 11:20pm Saturday night and he didn't get to see a Doctor until 6am Sunday morning! Totally unacceptable! The disruptions from criminals that were brought in by the police (7 police in the time we were there), wasn't right as they were getting seen before everyone else that had been waiting hours, because they were making a scene. They should be put in a separate room if that's the case and wait their turn like the rest of us away from everyone else trying to deal with their own issues as to why they were in A & E.

A 6 1/2 hour wait is totally outrageous. Especially, having to sit on very uncomfortable seating the whole time, not knowing when you're going to be seen.

When my husband asked if he could be told when he would be seeing a doctor, the answer she gave was, "I don't know". Again, this is very wrong. You have computer systems and everyone checks in and all the details are entered when obs are taken, bloods etc.

The system is totally broken and needs to be fixed. Us hard working people haven't worked all our lives, paying our national insurance to have to deal with this every time you need help with a medical issue at a & e or any department in the hospital for that matter.

On a side note, the staff were amazing and we have no complaints there at all. They work very hard and do the best with what they have been given.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I attended after GP advised me I may have a blood clot, very concerned & attended as advised for d dimer bloods, was triaged quickly the 2 triage nurses settled my worries, waited maybe 10 mins went through to a Nurse & phlebotomist, the bloods were taken & seeing as the phlebotomist was training the nurse beside her must surely be the best teacher as I have bloods taken regularly as diabetic & always have massive bruising just one of them things but have to say afterwards I couldn't even see where the bloods were taken & 2 days after only have a minimal bruise "excellent" & the Nurse was outstanding, done exactly what she said she was going to do & rang me with blood results. I'm very grateful for the care I received at Huyton Walk in centre thank those nurses please, honestly superb

title: poor check in
body: The check in machine situated on the desk for your appointment does not work so this means you have to tell the reception desk staff who are usually very busy with calls, if you take a seat then you will miss your appointment as happened to myself with my 92 year old mom today, we sat waiting forty mins until we could get to the desk once reception had a soace between calls, this needs a much better system or the machine fixed!

title: worst experience
body:
I went there a few times and I found that the GP was closed because all of them went to have lunch at the same time.
When calling them you will find hard to discuss with your doctor, or to schedule a blood test, or even to get the results you have to call early in the morning otherwise they are not telling you the results.
No online bookings, no online contact.
Only phone and is very hard to sort something because they will alsways find a reason to tell you to call another time.

title: Horrendous phone line system
body:
Unfortunately the reception system here let's down the whole practice. Today I spent 3 hours on hold to then be disconnected! This is not the first time. On average it takes one hour to speak to a human if the phone loop lets you through.
I have found most of my dealings with Kingsbury reception disappointing to say the least.
Please please please update your phone systems and bring in people that have pride and customer service as their top priority.
All doctors I have had dealings with have been amazing!

title: Disgraceful
body: Husband has really high blood pressure, had 3 visits to docs, took 7 days worth of reads handed them in two weeks later I called because he had not heard anything to be told they could not find them, they found them and said he neeced to go in for medication, he went in (bearing in mind he is only home weekends) and they wanted blood, my husband is petrified of needles so he said no, nurse told him that is all he was in for, husband said no he was told medication, nurse said she is not allowed to prescrib it so he left, I called today to be told will not prescrib without blood texts,again told them he is petried of needles to be told he will not get medication then, really not even try to come up with a solution knowing he is at high risk of a stroke, you are just leaving himwith a ridiculously high blood pressure.

title: inadequate thought
body:
before going to appoinment asked for the time to be changed. refused. patient had to wait for his medication at his care home as shift change was at 8.00am. appoinment was 8-40. traffic down hagley road was terrible. visibility of clinic was grey on grey. nowhere to park with all the road markings. appoinment cancelled for being 15 minutes late. could not speak in such a stressed state.
staff at attwood must know of traffic difficulties and finding the venue. poorly thought out appoinment timetable

author: orangepp55
title: Nothing was too much trouble
body: 4th baby, 1st time induction. Previous complications to other births so very anxious. The midwives were fantastic and empathetic. Nothing was too much trouble.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: A friendly medical practice that always goes the…
body: I joined Robin Lane medical practice over 5 years ago and am so pleased that I did. The medical staff are welcoming, king, highly skilled and very supportive. I have had a few ups and downs since I retired in 2018 and the staff at Robin Lane have always been there for me. The practice is also constantly seeking new ways to support their patients. For example, Robin Lane was an early adopter of Systmonline and have recently engaged with the new PATCHs system . These are all designed to support patients that need to speak to or have a face-to-face appointment with either a GP, a nurse or both. And the systems are intuitive and work extremely well. The practice itself is light and airy and the staff are happy and well motivated. I know most of the staff by name and they are always welcoming. And the practice worked seamlessly through one of the arguably most challenging times in recent history, the Pandemic. I have nothing but praise for all of the staff at Robin Lane and am just so very grateful to them for all of their kind support for me over the recent years.

title: Awful awful awful
body:
Been a patient here since it opened when I was a child. Have stayed through convenience and ease but so fed up. Being told I am on a call back list and when I call 7 hours later I’m told I was called but no answer —- this has happened 3 times now. 

“Make an appointment the day your named GP works” unfortunately those aren’t the days I am off so I can’t make an appointment and it has to be daily list e consult which is full by 8am each day. If you do get a space you have to be able to answer you phone at any point in the next 48 hours. If you miss the call the whole debacle starts the next day again

This system does not work and this GP surgery constantly lets patients down! What a shame as they used to be amazing!

You have to stop blaming Covid now. Those of us working in acute settings have learnt new ways of working which don’t have detrimental effects on our patients

title: Took time and care
body:
The GP went beyond his duty
Spent extra time with me on a sensitive matter. Professional examination and took time to contact for a hospital referral. Thank You

title: Empathetic Staff
body: Spoke to doctor and had a blood test the same day, all the staff including receptionists were extremely professional, kind and attentive. I’m very impressed and grateful.

title: Rediculous customer service!!
body: I needed to make at least 200 calls just to book an appointment, and then gave me a phone call appointment which i can understand due to how busy they are, but they kept me waiting from 9am to 6:30pm for somebody to call but received nothing, they could’ve at least sent a text message, but nothing. I am very disappointed and urge for this GP to get improved soon.

title: positive feedback
body: I am very grateful to doctor who rang me urgently on 16 June referring me to hospital urgently after proactively chasing my blood test results, therefore I am very thankful for his rapid action showing good care and concern, I am also very thankful and appreciate all the help from the front desk staff with a smile, so keep up the good work

title: Value statistics and numbers over providing help
body:
As soon as you set foot on Trent pts premisses, you are robotically handed out a mandatory questionnaire to fill out, with loads of questions where you have to score your anxiety and depression levels. I struggled with them: not only did I find them intrusive but they reactivated part of the trauma I had come to seek help with. I explained it right from the start, through tears, to the therapist but still felt pressured into completing it, despite my reasons and its impact on me being clear. After having a discussion with management about my specific circumstances, the therapist later gave me an ultimatum: either I complete the questionnaires at every session or I am discharged. 

Explanations attempting to justify the decision were that these questionnaires are a therapeutic tool and an active part of treatment. However, Trent pts chronically failed to even acknowledge that patients are individuals with diverse needs and histories, hence making their questionnaires not necessarily beneficial to everyone, even detrimental to some, as proved where I am concerned. 

Their website claims to put patients at the centre of decisions made together, based on individual circumstances but in my experience, policy was implemented rigidly, insensitively and at any cost, despite having been made aware of the implications. 

Triggering a patient’s trauma for scoring purposes is clearly more important to this service than delivering the help needed to heal from it, which I find utterly shocking coming from a mental health organisation, which on top of everything else, is a public service supposed to be accessible to everyone in need. 

Following my experience with Trent pts, my mental and emotional health have not improved: on the contrary, they have deteriorated considerably. It is hard enough asking for help, and being made to feel like you are disqualified from receiving help changes your attitude towards seeking it. It is by far the worst experience I have had in terms of receiving therapeutic help.

title: Good Response!
body:
I have a worrying condition and Pinn medical were very good in managing it.
Booking the appointment was quite straightforward,  was given a prompt appointment as my condition is worrying.
Needed some further test and the receptionist was very accomodating in arranging them. 
Considering everything,  I  don't think Pinn medical could do more quite frankly

title: terrible
body:
cannot get an appointment... can't even speak to a human being! All appointments get taken while you  hold (number 34!) and then you're automatically cut off. 
It's a disgrace!

title: Terrible service
body:
I am absolutely appalled with the practice service 
I have been with them for over 15 years and the service of this practice and accessibility is absolutely terrible. Covid has been controlled but unfortunately the service from the GP has resumed the same. 
I was advised of abnormal blood test results and to urgently book an appointment by following a link- however when following this link all appointments were booked up and none wereavailable. 
I then went into practice only To be told to call everyday at 8am. I have called over twenty times from 7.59 and appointments have been booked. 
How the hell do I get an appointment

title: Great service.
body: Recently I had a phone call cardiology appointment which is a very good way to carry out patient screening, for both staff and patients, saving valuable time.  As a result of the consultation I received an appointment for a test to be carried out at TGH which  arrived soon after the initial consultation.  This was first class service as is always the case at TGH.  Well done the cardiology department and well done TGH.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good customer service
body: Nurse had phoned in sick. I was already arriving at the surgery when l was telephoned to advise me. Despite this they arranged for the practice nurse to see me and undertake the blood tests l was due to have at short notice.

title: First class care
body:
I had surgery for carpal tunnel syndrome and the care on the day of the procedure was first class.
Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff treated me with friendliness and respect.

title: Great GP appointment
body: Have received excellent advice and treatment for a long running problem. GP has taken his time to advise best treatment

title: Terrible doctors nurses and resptionist
body: They have passed me round for 3 weeks to get eat wax removal , resption booked me in for what I didn’t even ask for told me they would do what I said but didn’t I’m also pregnant and the have caused so much stress I will be telling everyone I know not to go to this doctors and I will be changing mine !

title: New hone system terrible
body: You ring through & get a long winded narrative about no appointments left, mid afternoon I would be very surprised if there was any left, being a patient for several years. This part of the service cannot be cut short or avoided, you have to wait for a full minute for him to finish explaining the obvious, then phone line seems to go dead for a few seconds before being put through to the surgery.  The old system was bad but easier to navigate and less lengthy due to being able to skip what you didn't need.

title: Marvellous staff
body: I attended for laparotomy, (ward t6 & Theatre 8, I think) everyone involved in my care - reception, nurses, health care assistants, doctors, anaesthatists, theatre team, porters, students, catering team - was friendly, caring, patient, cheerful, encouraging and professional. As a result my experience- arrival, preparation for surgery, recovery, overnight stay - was as good as it could have been, I think.

title: Great
body: I had laparoscopy in Princess Anne hospital two days ago. After my operation I transferred to Bramshaw ward. All nurses and sisters were amazing and caring. I can’t thank them enough for looking after me and other patients. They are absolutely wonderful and professional.

title: Great experience
body:
On Arrival at the Park hospital today the greeting was very pleasant, i was booked in and taken to the right department very efficiently and calmingly.
Once in the private room it was not long before i was given details of the procedure that was to follow.
Everyone involved were very thorough crossing the T’s and dotting the I’s in a reassuring way.
It was not long before going to the op room where once again the team where excellent
The examination and procedure I required was over in no time at all with very little discomfort (don’t know why i was worried about a camera in the privates).
Quickly moved on to the recovery room the staff nurse monitoring me was faultless and very informative.
Before i knew it i was being discharged.
I hope i don’t have to return but if i do will be more than happy to.
A big thanks and two thumbs up to all involved.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care has really been quite good thanks to the staff
body: I am currently in 3 north where the care that i have been getting has so far been really quite good i have not a problem with my experience so far. The care has really been quite good thanks to the staff they have been lovely. There really quite kind have taken the time to explain the care answer my questions and just reassure me. They have dealt with the PPE and everything very well and i am happy so far

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: The upmost care and consideration
body: Thankyou to all the staff working at children's a&e today between 12 and 6. my 21month old came in with a progressive wheeze, seen quickly and given so much care. He made good friends with all staff who were both supportive and understanding to me and how hard it is for a child of that age to stay in a small room for 8hours. Both my children have needed care at good hope children's a&e and I'm so grateful for having these caring people at a time of worry. You made a big difference to this moms day today thankyou

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Uncontactable
body: After 3 weeks from my initial appointment they elected to call me on my birthday with an update - what a day to call someone about such a sensitive topic. Didn’t pick up as was on holiday and call was from a “no called ID”. No voicemail but sent me an email later that day with an encrypted message that you can’t access from your phone and because I was abroad couldn’t therefore open it as didn’t have my laptop with me. Returned the call on my return to advise them I had been abroad, was told I would get a call back and this was over a week ago.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

author: Fiona35
title: Lack of care and compassion
body:
I had to bring my Mum to A&E with severe pain, not eating or drinking and various other acute issues. We were seen by an initial triage nurse who took basic obs, asked for "one sentence" on whats wrong and popped back into the waiting room. We then were asked to see a second triage nurse who wanted a more detailed history.  
My mum through her pain, tried to explain her complex history as well as how she was discharged recently from a ward (failed discharge). My Mum was then basically made to feel bad about attending a&e and why had she not tried other services. I stepped in to explain that currently she is being failed by the other services and that it's been a fight just to try and manage her pain. We were then told we would need to wait 6 hours to see a doctor, with no offer of pain relief, and that we should explore other avenues.  
I asked if they could phone the surgical team and see if my Mum could be readmitted directly. Several phonecalls later and we were told that they would need a GP referal. I went out and phoned the GP who was disgusted and arranged for her to be admitted. I was fortunate to be able to have a professional to professional discussion. However not everyone is this fortunate.  
I work in healthcare and know how stretched and underfunded services are. I would explore alternative avenues normally, however my Mum was in so much pain and so dehydrated it wasn't appropriate to try and wait with her history.  
Whilst I do not blame staff directly, the Hospital have failed my Mum on numerous occasions and as they do not wish to be a burden and highlight at the time, its always gone unsaid. It breaks my Heart when I hear lack of basic compassion and patient management. I have experience of several hospitals and on this occasion I feel that this hospital has failed in its basic duty of care.

title: 'The Good Doctor'
body: I normally see the same (a.s) doctor, who is 'the good doctor', as my doc is always in tune of my needs regards to my well being, health condition & issues. My doc, understands my sufferings & has a very high degree of empathy, whether it is my repeat prescription/s, health issues and/or none health issues e.g., admin concerns of mine, such as request for report etc, for which my doc takes a pragmatic approach at best of times, with logical thinking within reason/s; with conclusive clinical resolution/s.

title: Annual diabetes check
body: As always the collection of blood was done painlessly and no trying several times to find my vein. Professional and approachable staff member. Was able to ask questions and got informative responses.

title: Online consultations
body: You are told when you call to contact the surgery using their online medical request page but when you use it you either get no reply or an appointment booked far away…

title: Poor service from GP 111 and out of hours doctor
body:
Went to the pharmacy as 1st port of call was told I needed antibiotics. 
Phoned the doctors explained I need a prescription. Was told no appointments today explained I only needed a prescription but the receptionist unwilling to help. 
Phoned 111 and was told to go to pharmacy, explained I already been there and they told me to ring 111. 
Referred to out of hours GP to be told there is a 6 hr wait for a phone call. By the time the out of hours doctors called and gave me a prescription all the pharmacies were closed. What a joke of a service

author: romm1948
title: Great care but transport an issue
body:
I live in Dumfries & Galloway and had to travel to Falkirk for my pace maker operation. The care was excellent and I cannot fault anything during my over night stay. My only issue was that transport was not an option for me as I didnt meet the criteria. I wasn't allowed to drive myself due to having the operation and I struggling to get someone to agree to take and and nearly had to cancel my procedure. I did in the end get a lift but as its a 2 hour drive we had to leave at 6am. then I had to ask another person to collect me.  
I think if you are not allowed to drive the hospital should arrange patient transport for you. I hear many other people will also have to make the same journey from Dumfries to Falkirk going forward so worth thinking about.

author: woodpeckerbj95
title: Caring and professional staff
body:
Blisters appeared on my penis. I was seen on the Open clinic by caring and professional staff. Made me feel comfortable and safe.  
Fast appointment with doctor was arranged and treatment started while waiting for test results.

author: ophiuchusmf37
title: My treatment
body:
I was unsure of what this referral to pelvic physio would accomplish or how comfortable I would be talking about my problems. However, my physio Erin, put me completely at ease.
She had time for me to talk and I was able to discuss with her quite a few issues, some of which I had not even realised I could get help with.
Erin has given me more coping strategies and a positive approach for the future and what I can do to help myself.
I have just finished my course of appointments, but wouldn’t hesitate to try to talk Erin or another pelvic physio again in the future.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences
